Stob Coire Easain

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

A twin to neighbouring Stob a' Choire Mheadhoin, Stob Coire Easain shows a steep face to the northeast. This lengthy ridge lies between the deep trench of Loch Treig - traversed by the West Highland railway line - and the Lairig Leacach pass.

 You have not climbed Stob Coire Easain.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 1115 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.68/5
Rating: 3.7/5 (59 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

The Easains ridge from near Fersit

Other routes and challenges

The route given above is almost invariably used for ascents of both Munros on the ridge.

Other possibilities include an approach from the Lairig Leacach, or from the head of Loch Treig - perhaps as long traverse, heading up the south ridge on a route between Corrour and Tulloch stations.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Spean Bridge Hotels

Spean Bridge B&B

Spean Bridge Cottages

Lochaber Hostels
